description.narrative: The Project is expected to have a significant development impact as it will enhance the Bank''s ability to lend more to SMEs and households in frontier regions of the Eastern Russia. Such financing will be crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector and diversification of the regional economies where the Bank operates (including 9 frontier regions, defined as having per capita income 80% or less of the national average). Additional developmental impact lies in the introduction of the Bank and its unique business model to the international wholesale funding market, by possibly marketing its debut syndication.

The proposed project consists of an A-Loan denominated in Russian Rubles at IFCs own account of up to US$30 million (approximately equivalent to RUB882.2 million) for up to five years, and a B/parallel-Loan of up to US$30 million. The loans are intended to support the Banks onlending to small and medium enterprises in the Far East and Siberia Federal Districts of Russia. ATB is the largest regional bank in the Russian Far East and Siberia, headquartered in Blagoveshchensk. The Bank is focused on retail lending, but has a significant corporate loan and SME loan portfolios. IFC has been engaged with the Bank since 2008 and is a shareholder with a 7% stake. The Bank operates through a branch chain including 221 offices, located in 18 regions of Russia, 60% of which are frontier regions.
